Detection of commands or registry modifi.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 4657, Windows Event ID 7035
Detection of commands or registry modifi.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for command-line arguments containing 'sc stop EventLog', 'sc config eventlog start=disabled', 'Set-Service -Name EventLog -Status Stopped', 'auditpol /clear', 'auditpol /remove', or 'auditpol /set /category...'. Monitor Windows Event ID 4657 for modifications to HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Start or HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\WMI\Autologger\...Start. Monitor Windows Event ID 7035 for EventLog service termination.

Presence of Windows Event IDs indicating.Data: Windows Event ID 1102, Windows Event ID 104
Presence of Windows Event IDs indicating.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 1102 (Security log) and Windows Event ID 104 (System log) for log clearing events. Analyze sequential Event Record IDs within Security and System logs to identify sudden jumps or significant gaps, indicating potential log deletion or tampering. Use time series analysis to plot log volume over time and identify sudden drops.
